text.tspan: And as we travel a few years forward in time, we meet two brothers - Charles and
Frank Duryea. Charles had his hands full with his bicycle business, but in 1886 a gas
oline engine caught his attention. ”Seems like it’s going to power a carriage or a
wagon”, he thought - and not so long after the brothers came up with one of the
Tale as old as time, fame can have its drawbacks. The brothers ended up in a disa
greement about who was actually behind this great invention. Whereas Charles
claimed to be the leader of the project, Frank took the credit of making the engine
and transmission perfect while his brother was away. However, despite the disa
greements of the brothers, the car made a successful appearance in Springfield in
